result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon C. Blackcoon

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order
Jury trial - 12 person on June 28, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Final pre-trial on June 8, 2023 at 09:30 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

3:13 PM Defendant Leon C. Blackcoon appeared by video.  Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Leon C. Blackcoon. (21CF151 in front of Judge Diehn being set for trial)  Set for trial. Atty will call JA.
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for PTC 7/13    Set for STC 8/15 @ 3 PM. 
Reset Judge Diehn's STC on case 21CF151 STC date set for 8/1 @ 3 PM to allow parties to hold PTC.

12:02 PM Defendant Leon C. Blackcoon in court.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow in court for Leon C. Blackcoon. State calls witness JCSD A. J.; sworn. employed with JDSD, 5/4/2022 on duty. Testifies to responding to a disturbance call. Made contact with both complainants. Record reflects identification of defendant. Defendant pushed witness down. Testified to general medical status of witness. Made contact with defendant. State makes a record to deputies size. Cross examination from Atty Grabow. Defendant denied pushing witness on couch. No redirect. No other witnesses. State references JC case # 21CF151 asking the court to take judicial notice - defendant is on bond for that matter. Court  recites signature bond on 21CF151  taking judicial notice of that bond. Defense objects to bind over. State in compliance with victim rights notices. Defense makes argument.  Probable cause found.

Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

YOU MAY APPEAR EITHER IN PERSON OR BY ZOOM UNLESS ORDERED OTHERWISE BY THE COURT.

Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:32 AM Defendant Leon C. Blackcoon appeared by video.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Leon C. Blackcoon. Defendant agrees to appear by video. Waive reading of the complaint.  PTC set for 7/6 and STC set for 8/15. Set Preliminary Hearing w/in time limits. Allow 30 minutes in person appearance.

1:12 PM Defendant Leon C. Blackcoon appeared by video.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Leon C. Blackcoon. Atty Grabow states motions. State opposes modification. Atty Grabow responds. Court denies motion.

Motion hearing on June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:27 PM Defendant Leon C. Blackcoon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He has a SPD attorney on another case.  Atty Swank appears specially and states he will need to reapply. He is to contact SPD. Court finds probable cause to set a bond. Would like text reminders 773-453-8590.  AIA set for 5/23 at 9 am.
To Seal ID Key
